snippet: An American Indian child at the center of a custody suit should be returned to the Charleston-area couple seeking to adopt her, the State Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday.
abstract: South Carolina State Supreme Court rules that American Indian child named Veronia, who is at the center of a custody suit, should be returned to Charleston-area couple seeking to adopt her; state courts originally said federal law intended to keep Indian children from being taken from their homes favored her living with her biological father.
lead_paragraph: An American Indian child at the center of a custody suit should be returned to the Charleston-area couple seeking to adopt her, the State Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday.

headline.main: South Carolina: American Indian Father Loses Adoption Dispute
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Indian Father Loses Adoption Dispute
